current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the withdrawal and protection of certain
		  Federal land in the State of Colorado, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

short-title.#text:
Thompson Divide Withdrawal and
			 Protection Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

the Thompson
			 Divide in western Colorado is an area comprised of Federal and non-Federal land
			 that provides important watershed, scenic, rec­re­a­tion­al, wildlife, and
			 other benefits to the general public and local communities;

the Thompson
			 Divide provides rural character, a robust agriculture-based economy, and
			 outstanding recreational and sporting opportunities to many surrounding
			 communities; and

the Thompson
			 Divide provides important spring and summer grazing land for historical
			 ranching operations.

The
			 purposes of this Act are—

subject to valid
			 existing rights, to withdraw certain Federal land and mineral rights in the
			 Thompson Divide Withdrawal and Protection Area from—

disposition under
			 the mineral and geothermal leasing laws of the United States;

location, patent,
			 and entry under mining laws of the United States; and

all forms of
			 appropriation or disposal under the public land laws; and

to allow for the
			 retirement, purchase, donation, voluntary exchange, or other acquisition of
			 mineral and other interests in land from willing sellers within the Thompson
			 Divide Withdrawal and Protection Area.
In this Act:

The
			 term

term.#tail: means the Secretary of the Interior.

text.#text:
The
			 term

term.#tail:
means the Federal land consisting of the
			 approximately 183,000 acres depicted on the map as
term.#text:
Thompson Divide
			 Withdrawal and Protection Area

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Thompson Divide
			 Withdrawal and Protection Area

Thompson Divide
			 Withdrawal and Protection Area

text.#text:
Subject to valid existing rights, the Thompson Divide
			 Withdrawal and Protection Area is withdrawn from all forms of—

entry,
			 appropriation, and disposal under the public land laws;

location, entry,
			 and patent under mining laws; and

operation of the
			 mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

The
			 exact acreage and legal description of the Thompson Divide Withdrawal and
			 Protection Area shall be determined by surveys approved by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 shall provide written notice to holders of valid existing mineral leases or
			 other mineral interests within the Thompson Divide Withdrawal and Protection
			 Area of the potential opportunity for donation, voluntary exchange, or other
			 relinquishment of those rights for retirement under this Act.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of
			 this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,

			 Divide Withdrawal and Protection Area may submit a written notice to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of the interest of the holder in the retirement or other conveyance
			 of that right for withdrawal and protection purposes.

the

section 170(h) of the Internal Revenue Code

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or under the authority of the

concerned, be automatically withdrawn from all forms of—

text.#text:
If any mineral lease or other mineral interest is
			 relinquished, donated to, exchanged, or otherwise acquired by the United States
			 wholly or partially within the Thompson Divide Withdrawal and Protection Area
			 under

entry,
			 appropriation, and disposal under the public land laws;

location, entry,
			 and patent under mining laws; and

operation of the
			 mineral leasing, mineral materials, and geothermal leasing laws.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not use Federal funds to
			 repurchase any valid Federal mineral lease or other mineral interest within the
			 Thompson Divide Withdrawal and Protection Area.

text.#text: The

Nothing in this Act expands, diminishes, impairs, or
			 otherwise affects any valid existing mineral leases, mineral interest, or other
			 private property rights wholly or partially within the Thompson Divide
			 Withdrawal and Protection Area, including access to the leases, rights, or land
			 in accordance with applicable Federal, State, and local laws (including
			 regulations).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from taking any
			 action necessary to issue, deny, remove the suspension of, or cancel a lease or
			 any sold lease parcel that has not been issued pursuant to any lease sale
			 carried out prior to the date of enactment of this Act, including the
			 completion of any requirements under the
